about.history: Seejeh (also known as Seega) is an ancient Egyptian board game with roots dating back thousands of years. This digital version features intelligent AI opponents with adjustable difficulty levels, allowing you to learn and master this traditional strategic game at your own pace.

rules.title: Game Rules
rules.placement: Placement: Players alternate placing 2 stones per turn (48 total)
rules.movement: Movement: Move one stone orthogonally one step
rules.capture: Capture: Sandwich opponent stones between your pieces
rules.win: Win: Reduce opponent to 7 or fewer stones

about.sources: Sources: Bell, R.C. (1979). Board and Table Games from Many Civilizations
